Reviews.Title: “Really nice, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: triptots
Reviews.Content: Our family was surprised at how nice this experience was: we had a 2 bedroom suite with a sitting room and small kitchen, both beds were very good quality. The accommodations were spacious, comfortable, even the kitchen was well equipped. The breakfast was one of the better "included-type" meals, and the facility was immaculate and cheerful. There were plenty of places to relax around the facility and the location was close to freeway, etc. Very quiet, staff very professional. We only stayed one night but we would have enjoyed a longer stay. Very easy parking... was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Great for budget minded family”
Reviews.Author: CaliFlip
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was awesome! I had scoured the Internet looking for the right hotel for 5 people.....they had it all...the suite had a kitchen complete with full size fridge,dishwasher and microwave...pot,pan,eating utensil..even small bottle of dish washing liquid. We had a one bedroom suite w/2full beds and the living room had the sofa bed...free hot breakfast w/ a wonderful lady who was fast and kept the area stocked...something for everyone..each day changed for stuff like sausage or bacon ..there was eggs,potatoes,oatmeal,toast,bagels,waffle iron to make your own Belgian waffle,coffee,tea,fruit,juice,hard oiled eggs,cereal....also there was a washer and dryer free to use..just buy some soap fr the front desk convenience shop...small gym..pool..the nice thing was the free dinner served nightly....when I was there it was taco night one night...(missed it when we went to sea world). The next night was BBQ...grilled burgers and hot dogs..with chips..drinks..beer...wine too I think? :0). One main thing here I liked was the incredibly friendly staff....awesome... They have a business center if you need Internet and to print things like boarding passes...in the same room books to read and even movies to borrow too.....not new movies but that's ok. The area is quiet and there a lot of places nearby to eat or if you need anything...within a 5 or 10 minute drive...costco and claim jumper are across the street along with a ton of other places...soooo convenient....I definitely would come back...lots of bang for your buck....not fancy..but clean...and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: Alba-roadtrippers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights on a long holiday to USA. From check in to departure the staff were friendly and attentive. On arrival we were wlcomed as priority club members given a "goody bag" and a room upgrade even though I was paying partially with points. The breakfasts and evening reception food was good and the property clean and well maintained. The location was great for the safari wild animal park and even though it is a few miles from San Diego we had no trouble getting to sea world or San Diego, may have been more of a problem without sat-nav. Facilities such as laundry and computer access were great to catch up and being able to "dine in" is a welcome change on a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Staybridge with a Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cherie C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 1 Bedroom suite for 8 nights for business meetings and ended up extending for another 7 nights. The hotel, suite and grounds are immaculate. The 1 Bedroom Suite was very convenient. Separate sleeping quarters plus a kitchen, living and work area is very convenient. The staff was friendly and accommodating and very well trained. We were given every courtesy with our request to extend. The lobby and meeting areas were always clean and well attended. We loved the location: Convenient to go in any direction yet not congested to get to. The hotel is located far enough off the freeway to not have to deal with any traffic noise. The setting is beautiful and peaceful and quiet. There are several restaurants very close in addition to a Costco and regular drug & grocery stores nearby. It ended up being one of the best stays we have ever had in a hotel. One of our business meetings was held in the lobby area and the attendees looked around and said they wished their rooms were at the Staybridge!! We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Facility”
Reviews.Author: concrete-princess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights - 2 adults and 3 children in a corner 2 bdrm suite. The room was ideal for us with 2 teenage girls they had their own bdrm and washroom. The staff was attentive and the light reception in the evening was great everyday. The location worked well for us as it was central to our daily destinations. Most days we did not go into San Diego before 9:00 a.m. so traffic was never an issue. There was convenient grocery shopping nearby including a Costco across the street. The only negative was doing laundry on Saturday evening but we were told that was the busiest day of the week. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but a decent location”
Reviews.Author: shaheenhamza
Reviews.Content: I stayed in at this hotel for 3 months as I was in the area visiting a corporate client for some business proposal. The room decor was pretty outdated, but they were cleaned daily by the housekeeping staff. Parking space is ample and there is a basketball court and a pool which rarely anyone uses. Breakfast was decent. Best part of the hotel was the staff. They were pretty friendly. Housekeeping staff were all Mexican and had a tough time understanding English. With many restaurants in the vicinity, its a perfect location, with all required stores, atm, supermarkets etc..

Reviews.Title: “All around, a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: familyof5scottsdale
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 day stay at Staybridge. Our entire family was impressed with the property---from the front desk, to the folks that prepare breakfast, to the housekeeping, this is a well run place. The rooms are spotless, and the employees go out of their way to be helpful. The only negative is that the sleeper sofa in our room DESPERATELY needs a new mattress....it is like a bed of nails. The property is close to shopping, restaurants, and freeway access. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - next best thing to home”
Reviews.Author: basedogg
Reviews.Content: I relocated to San Diego for a job and I stayed here for about a month. This place is great all around. Its nothing fancy, but has everything you need, including free laundry, two gas grills by the pool and free happy hour Tues-Thurs. The staff was great. ICH gets a big thumbs up for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, warm staff”
Reviews.Author: Karthiv
Reviews.Content: Nice play to stay. This is the first time I stayed in StayBridge, but wonderful experience. Warm service and neat rooms, with well equipped kitchen. Ideal for international travellers who comes for long stay. Fitness Center is little cramped, as it's combined with wash area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Central Location for Attractions”
Reviews.Author: 2hapamama
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here. We stayed at another hotel for two nights and when they didn't have availability for us to extend, we moved to the Staybridge. The whole family agreed that we wished we had stayed here the whole time. Our room was simple and spotless. The full kitchen was great for dining in with the kids. The sofa bed and king bed were perfect for us. There was a nice pool area and new BBQ's that we noticed other guests enjoying. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate and a great value. The desk staff was very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Can not say enough good things about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snoopydoo
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay in San Diego before we headed up to LA for the bulk of our vacation. I wish we could take this hotel and it's staff with us to LA! The desk clerk, Sam, was the best. Greeted us with "gifts" because we are Priority Club members (spring water and chocolates- and you have NO idea how parched I was at that very moment!) Then he also upgraded our room. Gave us "local" tips, just all around friendly. The room was great- clean and plenty of room. The price wasn't bad. ($119 plus tax) The breakfast was superb and had some things that were different than the usual Staybridge included fare. I have nothing even remotely negative to say about this hotel. All I can do is recommend it to anyone staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Two Bath Suites are hard to find”
Reviews.Author: angnphx
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were traveling with our 11-year-old son and my elderly/handicapped mother to celebrate his birthday and graduation from elementary school; as well as take my mother on the trip of a lifetime. I absolutely needed a suite with a 2 bed\2 bath setup, as my son was afraid to be alone with his grandmother who had recently been very ill. Finding any hotelâ€™s that provide 2 bed/2 bath suites was excruciatingly time consuming. Luckily, after a lot of research and comparisons on travel sites I chose Staybridge. They offered exactly what I was looking for â€“ a true suite (small apartment) with 2 bed\2 bath and a sleeper sofa in the living area â€“ at a reasonable price! It was extremely clean, comfortable and well maintained & someone else cleaned up, brought in fresh towels & made the beds! Short of a waterfront view, I would not have asked for more. It is off the beaten path and a little ways from the attractions, restaurants and night life - but it is extremely quite, so the short drive was worth the quality of rest time in the hotel. Staybridge does have a hotel closer to the attractions, but for my family the nightly rate increase was a consideration over the 5 days we stayed. I have seriously recommended this hotel with great enthusiasm to many of my friends & I do plan to stay there again. I will look for a Staybridge in every city I travel to â€“ THE STAY WAS THAT GOOD!! A last note: Parking was FREE.. This is apparently rare in San Diego & is definitely something to factor into your trip planning. Most hotels charge $15.00 and up for parking NIGHTLY!

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RichardinNJ
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Staybridge Suites in Rancho Bernardo for at least 10 days each August since 2006. We will return next month. We have stayed at many hotels in the San Diego area. This is easily our favorite hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast is tasty and there are abundant selections; the Sundowner Receptions are a fun way to end a busy day. The pool is relaxing, there is ample parking, and the laundry facilities are a bonus. I would be remiss if I did not mention that the general manager and her staff are professional, courteous, readily available, helpful and personable. I recommend this hotel with enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay w/ (or w/o) Your Pet”
Reviews.Author: wheelies29
Reviews.Content: I had to find a place to stay in Rancho Bernardo that took pets, but wasn't a hole. This place is a 5 star resort. Not only that, but they don't gouge you for the pet's stay. Most places want to charge you a $75 non-refundable deposit!! Non-refundable?? If my dog didn't damage the room, why can't i have it back?? Anyhow, this place charges an additional $15 a night charge. Very reasonable. We stayed in a queen suite, which included a small kitchen area w/full sized fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher and sink. More than adequate for me. There was also a coffee pot and toaster, dishes, flatware and pots and pans, so the kitchen is very usable. Lots of pillows and a pull out couch. The bed was very comfy. The room was very clean. The front desk called me about an hour after i arrived to make sure everything was to my liking. Nice touch, i thought. I can't remember the last time that happened. The property itself is really family friendly w/outdoor sport court, pool and BBQ's!! Laundry room that is complimentary, except you need detergent and dryer sheets which they conveniently have in their 24 hour kiosk that has snacks too!! Free breakfast, but i didn't get to check it out 'cuz i had to leave before it was opened...but it smelled good as they were getting it ready. There is a great room off the reception area and i believe i saw some computers to access the internet. My rate was a bit high, but i booked the day before my arrival so i really can't complain. The only down side here is it's far from everything. You definately need a vehicle as you couldn't really walk to anything. I did see they offered a free shuttle w/in 5 miles, but i didn't use it so i can't comment. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mrs_debe
Reviews.Content: I just have to say I highly recommend this facility. There were NO bedbugs. Rooms were very clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and knowledgable, the breakfast and sundowner was better than I expected, the parking was ample. Everything we wanted was here except a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “BIT BY BED BUGS! 80 welts on my body!”
Reviews.Author: buggingout
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 321 at Staybridge Suites in Rancho Bernardo., CA. I was bitten close to 80 times all over my body. My boss who stayed in the same room after I left, was bitten as well. He found a bed bug and showed it to the front desk attendant. They have yet to give me a full refund and have not even had someone inspect the room since this happened last week. The manager I spoke to was so nonchalant about the matter when I spoke to him. On top of being bitten and having experienced a bad reaction to the bites, we are now having to deal with the transport of the bugs to our home. I am disappointed with the way management handled mine and my boss's complaint .

Reviews.Title: “Quiet; comfortable; great staff.”
Reviews.Author: sharon2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights while visiting relatives. We treated ourselves to a large suite and it was absolutely quiet and comfortable. We enjoyed the cocktail hour during the week, with free drinks and a light dinner. The staff is very helpful and upbeat and even the guests walk around with smiles on their faces. This hotel has a very positive vibe! I left my cell phone charger in the room and when I got home there was a message from the hotel that they'd found it and were mailing it to me. How often does that happen?

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: SlickAgent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Staybridge in Orlando a couple of years ago and always wanted to try it again. This location did not disappoint. The rooms were big and clean. The air conditioning was awesome. The free breakfast buffet was really good. You actually can be pretty creative with the options of food given. The pool is not big, but it was nice and refreshing. Lots of cable TV choices, 3 ESPN options on College Football Saturday made a difference. The beds were a little stiff. But overall, we would comeback to this location the next time we are in the San Diego area. The staff was great at the beginning and the end.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: tedandlisa90
Reviews.Content: We choose Staybridge Suites specifically for the location and previous reviews. We usually stay at a Marriott or Hilton Vacation club locations because of the needed size and space. However in San Diego these options are few if any. And our favorite locations in SD are either in the Gaslamp or Marina area. For this trip, we were in town for our daughter's softball tournament which was going to be held at Kit Carson Park Escondido and again Quality hotels in this area are very limited. Because of the great reviews of Staybridge we decided to try it out since it was a quick freeway drive about 10 minutes away from the park. We were very pleased with our choice. We had a 2 bedroom suite which consisted of a master bedroom with a king size bed and bath and an additional bedroom with a queen bed and bath, TV's in each room in addition to living and dining area and small kitchen. I really had nothing bad to say about the space. In fact I really loved the layout which was very different to the usual 2 bedroom suite layouts which IMHO made better use of a smaller space without leaving out or missing anything. Beds were extremely comfortable, wifi, dvd player in rooms, Kitchen utensils etc.. I feel 199.00 per night for our stay that weekend was a great value for this type of suite in SD. The surrounding area is business and residential. Its tucked away from a couple of medical buildings on a culdasac. But don't let that deter you its a quiet and pretty area with lots of trees and a nice pool and BBQ area. seriously you wouldn't even know your there amoungst businesses. Across the main road there's a Costco if your stay is long and need supplies. Also, there's a Claim Jumper restaurant that we enjoyed which is in the same shopping center across the street. We also took a quick drive to beautiful Torrey Pines State bech which was a quick trip on Ted Williams freeway a straight to the beach. The Hotel looks to be pretty new and the decor warm and inviting we didn't get a chance to try out the snacks they offer during the week but we did try the complimentary breakfast which was actually very good. Nothing fancy but better than I expected. they also had washer and dryer facilities and business and excercise facilities. The only thing they lacked in this area was an Ice macine which I think they should have. I guess because most rooms have a refrigerator with an ice maker but that takes a while to get going. They were kind enough to get ice from their pantries to fill many families Ice chests and ours as well and I thought that was great customer service. Along those lines there were many times thru-out our stay that some person in the staff genuiely offered help. Weather it be for directions, help carrying bags, assisting to make sure everything was ok. I haven't seen this type of consistent staff service in a long time! if you need to stay a bit further north of downtown and you need the space I would highly recommend this nice place, the Staybridge suites!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: greenwks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in July 2009 while in the San Diego area to visit SD Zoo and Sea World. Our one bedroom suite was clean, comfortable and very spacious for 2 adults and one child. We had a king bed in the bedroom and the couch in the living room folded out into a bed. There was an extra mattress pad on top of the mattress and the check-in agent even offered to bring up another mattress pad when we checked-in, so we had 2 cushiony pads and the bed was comfortable. We did request 2 beds on the top (3rd) floor and didn't receive either request, so that was a slight disappointment, but it turned out just fine. Our room looked out over the pool and was a nice view. There was minimal noise from being so close to the pool and they closed it promptly at 10pm. Our room had free WiFi and there was a laundry room that was free (bring your soap).There was a free, full breakfast every morning with eggs, waffles, breakfast meats, pastries, oatmeal, cereal, juice, etc. Tues-Thurs night there was a free "dinner" that we were surprised to see. The first night they had grilled hamburgers and hot dogs. There was tap beer and saki, too! If you'd like to grill your own food, they have a really nice patio area with 2 propane grills and they provide the utensils. It took us about 30 minutes or less to get to Sea World, zoo, Coronado start to finish. The neighborhood was very clean, nicely landscaped and seemed like a business park type of neighborhood. A CostCo, Target, CVS and many other stores were nearby. Overall, considering the full kitchen, the separate bedroom, cleanliness, good customer service and good location, food included, this hotel was a very good value and we would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: eve_skye
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, spacious rooms, lots to do and a great location. We stayed in a 2 bedroom / 2 bath with living with fold out couch and kitchenette. We had our 4 kids and my husband and I there for a week and it was worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Mehridith
Reviews.Content: Our 1 bdrm suite was nicely appointed, clean, and quiet. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was pretty good. The room was bigger than most places like this that we've stayed and we'll likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Hidden San Diego Getaway.”
Reviews.Author: ChavSanti
Reviews.Content: We actually live a couple miles from this hotel. We stayed here for a little getaway from the kids. We wanted to be close enough just in case we had to rush back. This place is located in Carmel Mountain Ranch (San Diego), about a mile from the 15 freeway, in a commercial area (Northrop, UCSD Annex) and next to a Scripp's medical clinic. Across the street there is a CostCo, Claim Jumpers, Islands and PickUp Stix. About 3 blocks down is a shopping plaza with Ross, Mervyn's, Sears, Borders, etc. We paid $95 for a Saturday stay. Booked online using a AAA discount. Parking is free. Checking in was quick and painless. They even gave us a goody bag with water and chocolate for being a Priority Club member (free online to join). Also, with the membership, we were offered a 3:00pm late check-out following day instead of 12:00PM. The room was a decent size with a queen bed and sofa. It had a kitchenette with a frig, micro, sink, stove and utensils. Room was clean with a modern decor. They have cable TV but NO PayPerView. Free wireless internet (or) the desk will let you borrow a network cable. The hotel is only 3 floors so no need to wait for the elevators. Quicker to walk. If you are staying less than 7 days, maid service is limited to changing towels and emptying trash. Extensive cleaning is only for customers staying for a lengthy stay. The hotel offered a free, hot breakfast the following morning. Eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, cereals, bread and juices. Does get crowded between 8:30am - 10:30am. (breakfast starts at 7:30AM on the weekends) Really bad, where certain food is not available. And with only 1 person working the breakfast bar, you can expect a long wait. They do have a coffee area that is available 24hrs. Fitness center and descent library on-site. The pool is 3-5 feet but no jacuzzi. This was a wonderful little hide-away for me and the wife. Close to many restaurants, shopping and our house. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for Wild animal park”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: the location is ideal for the animal park but perhaps a little too far out to make visting San Diego easy. We stayed in a 2 bedroomed 2 bath suite, one bedroom had 2 double beds the other a queen sized bed-ideal with 2 teenagers in tow.The suites are bright and airy with spacious living area and kitchen.Only fault - not a full oven and the 2 hotplates are difficult to work on [ no elbow room due to fridge being immediately on right side.] there is free use of the hotel washers and dryers-very useful! The pool is pleasant and there is a basketball court next door The included breakfast is very good-we stayed over a weekend so no experience of food provided during week.Supermarkets within easy drive

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation; ambivalent staff”
Reviews.Author: GALB
Reviews.Content: These accommodations were better than I expected. The rooms were large and comfortable. The kitchen had a full-size fridge. AND, they accepted our two dogs without a problem. The grounds are nice, and the hotel is in an upscale corporate park area, with company HQs and such nearby. Certain evenings, there were "free" dinner buffets available, but the best part is the Trader Joe's just down the street! BUT the staff seemed apathetic to my complaints about the clothes dryer that, after about 45 minutes, still left my clothes sopping wet. About 90 minutes after I complained, they still hadn't put up an "out of order" sign, so another unsuspecting guest had the same problem I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility.. but clientele is not so great”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler90
Reviews.Content: This is another lovely Staybridge site. Pros ------ 1. beautiful grounds -- flowers, flowering trees 2. nice choice of food for breakfast and sundowners.. Japanese staples provided : miso, rice, sake 3. rooms are clean and comfortable 4. parking is free and ample 5. Very close to Scripps medical and Sony. Surrounding area has a ton of restaurants and decent shopping/grocery stores. Cons ------ Unfortunately, due to its value, many families stay here. if you're a business person, this hotel is going to drive you crazy.. there are incompetent parents and their throngs of unruly toddlers in the gym, running and screaming down the hallways, running and screaming in the rooms, at the breakfast table, at the basketball court. It's like being in a daycare. You won't have a moment's peace from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mmsoko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Staybridge two nights while vacationing in San Diego. Chose the location because we were planning to visit the San Diego Wild Animal Park in Escondido. The park was just a short 10 minute drive from the hotel. The studio suite was slightly smaller than I expected. It included a kitchenette, sofa, desk, armoire w/TV and queen size bed. Should have reserved a one-BR suite for the three of us (our teenage son joined us). There was a nice pool (no one was in the pool, the weather was cool), a workout room, basketball court. There was a complimentary breakfast each morning. Son loved being able to make a waffle. The eating area was very pleasant. The bonus was on M,T,W & Th they have a "Sundowner" between 5:30 & 7:30. Didn't know what to expect. Thought it would be drinks and nibbles. But it was much more. One night there was beef stew, the second night, deli sandwiches. Drinks were complimentary wine, sodas, sake and beer. My teen thought this was the best! The business center was nice also. Two complimentary computers and printer. They simply ask that you limit your time so all guest have their turn. This was also the "library" with books, DVD's and games. There was a small self-serve store near the front desk, for items you may have forgotten and snacks. The hotel caters to business travelers but we found it to be great for our family. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Chickenbiscuit
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our weekend stay here and for $120 a night had a nice suite for ourselves and my mom and dad. Delicious breakfast each day with egg, sausage, juice, waffles, etc. Very young staff who may need some refresher training on customer relations. We had several requests which were never fulfilled through this younger staff. Perhaps the hotel puts the older, more experienced staff on during the week, as this is primarily a business hotel with guests staying for a week's duration. Very nice rooms with full fridge, stovetop, microwave, dishwasher, etc. Two televisions, one for the living room and the other for the bedroom. Driving distance to major downtown SD attractions was about twenty minutes from this location about 20 miles north of the city. Very close to the freeway, so this allows one to make much better time if going into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful-Great Bargain for family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This a GREAT place to stay. There were 4 adults and 1 child and we had plenty of room. The two bedroom is set-up very nice with each bedroom having its own full bathroom. The breakfasts were also wonderful and the five of us each could choose whatever we liked. The only complaint we had was although the pool was heated it was not heated enough. Would recommend this fine hotel to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good price”
Reviews.Author: ladyme1
Reviews.Content: We(family of 4) stayed here for a week during school vacation. I have only positive comments with this hotel. My kids are teenagers and need their "own" space when we travel. Had a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit on the 3rd floor. Small kitchen area with a full size fridge and microwave were great. Pull out sofa in the living area was big enough for my 16yo son. Daughter had a queen bed in her bedroom with a tv and plenty of space. The only inconvience was the 2nd bath was IN her bedroom. so, if she was sleeping our son had to actually go into her room to use the bathroom. we had a huge master bedroom with king size bed, lots of storage area and a full bath as well. Free internet access from your room. The rooms were clean and maintained well. The breakfast buffet was good and always had a changing item along with all the regular items. One day it had eggs, sausage, another day was pamcakes etc. always had fresh fruit, canned fruit, pastries, breads/bagels, make your own waffels, cereal, oatmeal, rice, breakfast bars and such. My daughter is a Veagn and could always find something to eat. Great way to start the da yand a huge convience. Therer is a room off the lobby/ dining area with 2 computers and printer that is assesible all day. We didn't bring a laptop, so this was a great way to stay in touch, print boarding passes and kids to chat with friends when we were back to the hotel for the evening. There is an evening reception with food, drinks, wine and beer 3 evenings a week. We were never back to the hotel to take advantage of these, so can't comment on them. The front desk people were always friendly, gave good advice and easy checkin/out. There is an adequate fitness area and FREE laundry room with several washers and dryers. they have laundry soap at the small store area in the lobby. the pool was small for the number of rooms but never saw more then a handful of people there. This was our 2nd trip to California in the past year, and I've come to the conclusion it never is real hot there so numerous people wanting to be in the pool area really isn't an issue. Being from Maine we expected southern California to be warmer then Maine..NOT!! For the price this was an excellent place to stay. Only consideration would be the travel distance to any of the "tourist" areas. We did have a decent ride in crazy traffic everyday.(avoid rush hours) Our Hertz rental car with Never Lost GPS was probably the smartest thing we did. We would have been lost literally 100's of times without it. We just typed in our destination and let the Never Lost get us there.. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lovely location - good for families”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in April (me, husband and 14 year old). The hotel is on a business park north of San Diego. It's a very nice area - with lots of restaurants close by (Claim Jumper is the closest). A car is essential. The suites are a good size (we had a two bedroom/two bath) what you expect from a Staybridge. The pool area is nice, but not huge - although it wasn't at al busy during our stay so it wasn't a problem. The only thing lacking is a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Distance is a Factor - Nice room - Long Drive - Idiot Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was an ok hotel. My wife and arrived w/ a late checkin (had called ahead a week before); The hotel staff person arrived at the door after we waited outside in the cold for 10 minutes...he had been smoking Marijuana; and couldn't figure out how to charge my credit card, give us a room card, or program the room card to open a room. Eventually, after 20 more minutes of waiting, we suggested that he just go and open a room for us, and we would get one in the morning; This he did...and tried to take our bags into the room and wanted a tip (as if)... Anyways, the rest of the stay was nice; the room was pretty spacious, bathroom nice, kitchenette a little odd in its placement but fully functional, working internet, nice lobby, and very clean as a whole. The other peoblem was the 30 minute drive to downtown. If you are not doing stuff downtown, dont sweat the distance. There are some decent restraunts nearby (olive garden, tgifriday, marie calender, the gold rush place, etc...) THere also is a theatre near by. Do take instructions from mapquest...it is hard to find on the first go around...kind of in an industrial type area.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites San Diego Rancho Bernardo Area
HotelInfo.Address: 11855 Avenue of Industry, San Diego, CA 92128
